examples.text: His friend was killed and he knows he is lucky to be alive.
She was lucky enough to be chosen for the team.
You were lucky (that) you spotted the danger in time.
In terms of my career I **feel** incredibly **lucky**.
You can **think yourself lucky** you didn't get mugged.
She **counted herself lucky** that she still had a job.
Mark is **one of the lucky ones**—he at least has somewhere to sleep.
the lucky winners
He was among the lucky ones who escaped with only minor injuries.
That was just plain lucky.
We've been pretty lucky so far.

definitions.definition: being the result of good luck
definitions.sensetop: lucky for somebody that…lucky for somebodylucky (that)

examples.text: It was lucky for us that we were able to go.
Lucky for her, a police car was passing.
It is lucky (that) neither was killed in the accident.
That was the luckiest escape of my life.
a lucky guess
A lucky find on the edge of the Cotswolds is helping archaeologists discover what life was like in Roman Britain.
I had a lucky break when I left school getting a job on local radio.
a lucky charm
The team thinks of me as their lucky mascot.
She hopes that some day she'll get lucky and win the jackpot.

definitions.definition: to meet somebody new and have sex with them

examples.text: Mike's hoping to get lucky tonight.

definitions.definition: used to show that you think somebody is lucky to have something, be able to do something, etc.

examples.text: ‘I'm off to Paris.’ ‘Lucky you!’
We certainly struck it lucky with the weather.

definitions.definition: to feel very grateful and lucky about something

examples.text: Just thank your lucky stars you weren’t in the house at the time.

definitions.definition: used when you have failed to do something twice and hope that you will succeed the third time
used to tell somebody that something that they are expecting probably will not happen

examples.text: ‘I was hoping to get a ticket for Saturday.’ ‘You'll be lucky.’

definitions.definition: used to tell somebody that they will probably not get what they are hoping for, and may not deserve it
